result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory P. Edelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed defendant is granted huber priveleges and 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report upon release from jail if agent has not previously made contact, to the probation and parole office.
Probation in 15CM131 and 15CM237 to run concurrent to each other.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted applied to cost of the action.   Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.
Defendant is to submit to a Psychological evaluation and release all records to the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. Exception to entering the above establishments  only as it may be required in the scope of employment and then only with permission of the agent.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.  
The defendant shall have no contact with  Desiree Garcia of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  
The defendant shall have no contact with Delilah Edelson of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way without Ms Edelson's permission as well as the agreement of the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory P. Edelson
